thread.title: Kacsor's knee injury ends college career
thread.title_full: Kacsor's knee injury ends college career

title: Kacsor's knee injury ends college career
text:
Kacsor's knee injury ends college career 
By Eric Dutkiewicz - 21Alive October 19, 2015 Updated Oct 19, 2015 at 11:49 PM EDT 
DAYTON, Ohio (21Alive) - Another local product playing college football has had his season cut short by injury. 
Running back Connor Kacsor tore his ACL in practice for the University of Dayton last week. 
The injury not only finishes his season, but ends his college career. 
Kacsor led the nation in the Football Championship Subdivision in rushing this season. 
He ends his career with 3,543 yards and 38 touchdowns at the time he went down to injury. 
Kacsor tore his ACL during his senior season at Leo High School.   To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
